text: By Ehtesham Arif — February 13, 2024 -  7:36 PM In a recent revelation, Google CEO Sundar Pichai shed light on his utilization of Gemini Advanced, Google’s latest subscription-based AI chatbot. Dubbed as the most advanced version yet, Gemini Advanced is powered by Gemini Ultra 1.0 LLM, a language understanding model that surpasses human experts in massive multitask language comprehension (MMLU). During an interview with CNBC, Pichai shared his personal experience with Gemini, emphasizing its role in enhancing his coding skills. He recounted an intriguing use-case scenario involving a friend’s endeavor to sell a house. Utilizing Gemini, they inputted images of the property and tasked the chatbot with crafting a compelling copy. To their amazement, Gemini not only grasped the architectural nuances but also produced a superior copy compared to their own efforts. Pichai marveled at Gemini’s ability to interpret images and provide insightful information. Whether it’s seeking additional details about intriguing finds on his phone or delving into various topics, Gemini consistently delivers valuable insights. Pichai’s endorsement underscores the transformative potential of AI in augmenting human capabilities. Explaining the rationale behind the transition from Bard to Gemini, Pichai elucidated that Gemini embodies Google’s overarching strategy in developing robust and secure AI models. By directly engaging with the underlying Gemini model, users experience a seamless interaction that epitomizes Google’s commitment to innovation and user experience. Pichai emphasized Gemini Advanced’s advancements in reasoning, instruction-following, coding, and creative collaboration. From serving as a personalized tutor tailored to individual learning styles to assisting in content strategy formulation and business planning, Gemini redefines the boundaries of AI applications. Google’s Ultra 1.0 model stands as a testament to the company’s relentless pursuit of excellence in AI development. With the capability to outperform human experts across a diverse array of subjects, including math, physics, history, law, medicine, and ethics, Gemini heralds a new era of intelligent computing.
